DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this international study is to describe the short- and long-term (i.e. up to 2 years following the index event) antithrombotic management patterns (AMPs) in patients hospitalized for acute coronary syndromes (ST segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI), Non-ST-Segment Elevation Acute Coronary Syndrome (NSTE-ACS)), and to document the impact of AMPs in clinical outcomes, economic variables and quality of life in a 'real-life' setting and to compare these between sites, countries and regions.
DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluating How Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome Are Managed During 2 Years After Discharge
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of myocardial infarction or unstable angina Hospitalized for the first time within 24 hours of onset of symptoms Presence of any condition/circumstance which in the opinion of the investigator could significantly limit the complete follow up of the patient (e.g. tourist, nonnative speaker or does not understand the local language, psychiatric disturbances) Current participation in a clinical trial.
